Source code for Vigenere

import Colors

color = Colors.textMod()



[docs]def print_tabula():
    recta = []
    for i in range(0, 26):
        line = ''
        for ii in range(0, 26):
            line = line + (chr(65 + ((ii + i) % 26)))
        recta.append(line)
    return recta




[docs]def printy_tabula(x, y):
    recta = []
    for i in range(0, 26):
        line = ''
        for ii in range(0, 26):
            if i == x:
                line = line + color.green + (chr(65 + ((ii) % 26))) + color.end
            else:
                if ii == y:
                    line = line + color.blue + (chr(65 + ((ii) % 26))) + color.end
                else:
                    line = line + (chr(65 + ((ii + i) % 26)))
        recta.append(line)
    return recta




[docs]def print_changes(line_num, org_char, new_char):
    tabby = print_tabula()
    i = line_num
    line = []
    for ii in range(0, 26):
        if (65 + ii) == ord(org_char):
            line.append(color.blue + (chr(65 + ((ii) % 26))) + color.end)
        elif (65 + ii) == ord(new_char):
            line.append(color.green + (chr(65 + ((ii) % 26))) + color.end)
        elif ii == 0:
            line.append(color.randy + (chr(65 + ((ii + i) % 26))) + color.end)
        else:
            line.append((chr(65 + ((ii + i) % 26))))
    print( ": Before", org_char, ":After", new_char, ":KeyWord", chr(line_num + 65))




[docs]def print_text(user_text):
    print("".join(user_text))




[docs]def encode(plainext, keyword):
    #  key(row) column(plaintext)
    cipher_text = []
    for c in range(len(plainext)):
        print_changes(get_alphabet(keyword[c % len(keyword)]), plainext[c],
                      chr((((ord(plainext[c]) - 65) + (ord(keyword[c % len(keyword)]) - 65)) % 26) + 65))
        cipher_text.append(chr((((ord(plainext[c]) - 65) + (ord(keyword[c % len(keyword)]) - 65)) % 26) + 65))
    return cipher_text




[docs]def correct_print(org_char, new_char, x, y):
    # we use the x,y to find the row and column
    output = ''
    for count in range(26):
        output = output + chr(((count + x) % 26) + 65)

    print(output)




[docs]def get_alphabet(char_to_be_converted):
    # this function takes in a-z and returns 0-25
    return ord(char_to_be_converted) - 65




[docs]def decode(cipher, keyword):
    tabula = print_tabula()  # list of lists that are the tabula
    plain = []
    for c in range(len(cipher)):
        plain.append(chr((((ord(cipher[c]) - 65) - (ord(keyword[c % len(keyword)]) - 65)) % 26) + 65))
        print_changes(get_alphabet(keyword[c % len(keyword)]), cipher[c],
                      chr((((ord(cipher[c]) - 65) - (ord(keyword[c % len(keyword)]) - 65)) % 26) + 65))
    return plain
